alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 12:49PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Laramie and southern Platte Counties through 130 PM MDT... At 1248 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Iron Mountain, or 29 miles northeast of Laramie, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Laramie and southern Platte Counties. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 38 and 42. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; South Laramie Range Foothills
